result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric E. Heine was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric E. Heine

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: The Court orders the defendant to reimburse Jefferson County for Court appointed attorney fees in the amount of $117.60

For Payment of Attorney Fees - It is hereby ordered that: The attorney fees shall be paid as a condition of probation.  The JOC shall be amended to reflect said order. An amended assessment report will be sent to probation and parole.
Petition for payment of attorney fees

Case called at 10:40am [mo]
Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV
Defendant Eric E. Heine in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Mr. Heine's case worker, Sheri Hyer is present in the Courtroom gallery.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
The Court has discussion with Mr. Heine

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:

--mental health assessment and treatment per Agent and Case Worker
--take all prescription drugs as prescribed
--anger management at the discretion of the Agent
--to undergo assessment, treatment or  counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no acts or threats of violence
--to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--to pay Domestic Abuse surcharge in the amount of $100


Days credit for time already served: 0  days
recess: 10:55am

Attorney Rhiel
Court orders reimbursement of $25 per month with the first payment due on 12/31/15

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 11:09 am [sf] 
Defendant Eric E. Heine in court. ADA John E K Fryatt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Defendant indicates that he wants to enter a plea.
ADA Fryatt indicates that it may be beneficial for the defendant to have counsel.
recess: 11:11 am to allow time for the defendant to talk with ADA Fryatt.
reconvene: 
Plea of "not guilty" entered

Court requires a $500.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence 

Refund cash bond to poster.
Court waives speedy trial for the moment, if the defendant would like a speedy trial, defendant can ask for a speedy trial at his return date, the Court allows the defendant until the Pretrial Conference to substitute Judge.

recess: 11:20 am
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Pretrial Conference: 11/25/15 at 9:00 am
Status: 12/11/15 at 10:30 am
